body.p: The two conditions we've outlined mean that we'll need two probabilities. These are:
the probability of having at least one child is which is found by calculating
the probability of having more than two children is which is found by calculating

response.name: P(X > 1)
response.feedback: Incorrect. We want at least one child, so having exactly one child would be acceptable. Please try again.

response.name: P(X ≥ 1)
response.feedback: Correct. At least one child means one or more.

response.name: P(X < 1)
response.feedback: Incorrect. You have chosen less than one, which is no children. This is not an acceptable result. Please try again.

response.name: P(X ≤ 1)
response.feedback: Incorrect. The symbol "≤" means at most one child. We want "at least" one child. Please try again.

response.name: 1 - P(X > 1)
response.feedback: Incorrect. The complement of at least one, is less than one. Please try again.

response.name: 1 - P(X ≥ 1)
response.feedback: Incorrect. You are correct that to find the complement you'd use: "1 - ..." However, you have not taken the complement of X ≥ 1. Please try again.

response.name: 1 - P(X < 1)
response.feedback: Correct. To find P(X ≥ 1), we must use complements, since technology uses only cumulative P(X ≤ x) probabilities. The complement of at least one, is less than one. However, we need less than or equal to something. Less than one is none, so we really have: 1 - P(X = 0).

response.name: 1 - P(X ≤ 1)
response.feedback: Incorrect. X ≤ 1 and X ≥ 1 are not complements, since they both contain X = 1. Please try again.

part.hint: Use complements, since all forms of technology use cumulative P(X ≤ x) binomial distributions to find a "greater than or equal to" probability.

response.name: P(X > 2)
response.feedback: Correct. More than two, which is the same as greater than two.

response.name: P(X ≥ 2)
response.feedback: Incorrect. You have "at least two," which includes two. We want strictly more than. Please try again.

response.name: P(X < 2)
response.feedback: Incorrect. You have chosen less than two, but we want more than two. Please try again.

response.name: P(X ≤ 2)
response.feedback: Incorrect. The symbol "≤" means at most two children. We want "more than" two children. Please try again.

part.hint: The key words here are "more than."

response.name: 1 - P(X > 2)
response.feedback: Incorrect. You are correct that to find the complement you'd use: "1 - ..." However, you have not taken the complement of X > 2. Please try again.

response.name: 1 - P(X ≥ 2)
response.feedback: Incorrect. You need the complement of X > 2. Please try again.

response.name: 1 - P(X < 2)
response.feedback: Incorrect. Less than 2 is not the complement of greater than 2, since neither includes X = 2. Please try again.

response.name: 1 - P(X ≤ 2)
response.feedback: Correct. To find P(X > 2) we need to use the complement, since technology finds only cumulative P(X ≤ x) probabilities. The complement of greater than two is less than or equal to two.

part.hint: Use complements, since all forms of technology use cumulative P(X ≤ x) binomial distributions to find a "greater than" probability.
